prior_message: Hey, you wanna do something tonight?
barney_message: Okay, meet me at the bar in fifteen minutes, and Suit up!

prior_message: Hey.
barney_message: Where's your suit!? Just once when I say suit up, I wish you'd put on a suit.

prior_message: I did that one time.
barney_message: It was a blazer!

prior_message: You know, ever since college it's been Marshall and Lily and me. Now it's going to be Marshall and Lily... and me. They'll get married, start a family-before long I'm the weird, middle-aged bachelor their kids call "Uncle Ted".
barney_message: I see what this is about. Have you forgotten what I said to you the night we met?

prior_message: Oh, right. Hi.
barney_message: Lesson one, lose the goatee. It doesn't look good with your suit.

prior_message: I'm not wearing a suit.
barney_message: Lesson two, get a suit. Suits are cool. Lesson three, don't even think about getting married till you're... thirty.

prior_message: Thirty, right. You're right. I guess it's just, you're best friend gets engaged-you start thinking about that stuff.
barney_message: I thought I was your best friend. Ted, say I'm your best friend.

prior_message: You're my best friend, Barney.
barney_message: Good! And as your best friend, I suggest we play a little game called... "Have you met Ted?"

prior_message: Wai-no, no, no. We're not playing "Have You Met Ted?"
Why am I freaking out all of a sudden? This is crazy! I'm not ready to settle down.
barney_message: how does Carl land a Lebanese girl?

prior_message: It's always been "don't even think about it till you're thirty"
barney_message: Exactly-the guy doesn't even own a suit!

prior_message: Hey Barney, see that girl?
barney_message: Hey, have you met Ted?

prior_message: that was fun.
barney_message: De-wait for it-nied! Denied!

prior_message: We're going out tomorrow night.
barney_message: I thought we were playing laser tag tomorrow night?

prior_message: Ted, anyone who's single would tell you the same thing. Even the dumbest single person alive, and if you don't believe me...call him.
barney_message: Hey loser, how's not playing laser tag? Because playing laser tag is awesome! Oh, I k*ll you Connor; don't make me get your mom!

prior_message: Hey, listen. I need your opinion on something.
barney_message: Okay, meet me at the bar in fifteen minutes-AND SUIT UP!

prior_message: So these guys think I chickened out. What do you think?
barney_message: I can't believe you're still not wearing a SUIT!

prior_message: She didn't even give me the signal.
barney_message: What is she goanna-is she goanna bat her eyes at you in Morse code Kiss me-No, you just kiss her!

prior_message: Not if you don't get the signal.
barney_message: Ee-(Kisses Marshal) Did Marshall give me the signal?

prior_message: No! I didn't, I swear.
barney_message: But see-at least, tonight, I get to sleep knowing, Marshall and Me... never going to happen. You should've kissed her.

prior_message: Urgh, I should've kissed her. What about when she gets back from Orlando?
barney_message: A week? That's like-a year in hot girl time. She'll forget all about you. Mark my words: you will never see that one again.

prior_message: I never do anything crazy! I'm always waiting for the moment! Planning the moment! Well she's leaving tomorrow this may be the only moment I'm goanna get! I gotta do what that guy couldn't, I gotta take the leap! Okay not a perfect metaphor, for me it's fall in love and get married-for him it's... death.
barney_message: Actually, that is a perfect metaphor. By the way, did I congratulate you two?

prior_message: ..Barney?
barney_message: Alright, but under one condition.
Ted's goanna get it on with a TV reporter

prior_message: Marshall, remember this night. When you're the best man at our wedding and you give a speech, you're goanna tell this story.
barney_message: Why does he get to be the best man? I'M YOUR BEST FRIEND!

prior_message: Go back in there!
barney_message: You're wearing a suit!

prior_message: He's in.
barney_message: So, Ranjit... you must've done it with a Lebanese girl.

prior_message: Actually, I'm from Bangladesh.
barney_message: The women hot there?

prior_message: Here's a picture of my wife!
barney_message: She's lovely.

prior_message: Yeah...
barney_message: You hate olives? Lily loves them, you can't stand them.

prior_message: Yeah, hate olives.
barney_message: Two weeks ago, Spanish bar on 79th Street, dish of olives-you had some. What up?

prior_message: You have to swear that this does not leave this cab.
barney_message: I swear.

prior_message: On our first date, I ordered a Greek salad; Lily asked if she could have my olives. I said, "Sure... I hate olives."
barney_message: But you like olives!

prior_message: Well, I was eighteen, okay? I was a virgin. Been waiting for my whole life for a pretty girl to want my olives.
barney_message: Marshall, I'm going to get you an early wedding present. Don't get married.

prior_message: It's been like twenty minutes. You think they're doin' it?
barney_message: You think they're doing it in front of the dogs?

prior_message: Doggie style.
barney_message: I had this girl in college; she had a golden retriever-

prior_message: Okay, we can go to the bar, just stop talking.
barney_message: Hit it Ranjit.

prior_message: That long lingering handshake-you should've kissed her!
barney_message: There's no such thing as the signal. But yeah-that was the signal.

prior_message: Guys, trust me. I've seen the signal. That was not the signal.
barney_message: Yeah Ted, we're not on you anymore.
